urls.title: Planners give green light to Otter Valley project
urls.description: A project to help a river valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve now has planning permission.

tweets.text: A ground breaking project to help the Lower Otter Valley in East Devon adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve has been approved by East Devon Council. Planners gave the project a unanimous thumbs-up earlier today https://t.co/1kIdi1CZcy https://t.co/y0bJb1aWsB

tweets.text: Pollution still pouring down the river Yare today at UEA. That‚Äôs 15 days  from first being reported now... the whole river reeks of diesel. Reported again to the EA. https://t.co/ZzcT2TK4RJ

.@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia ... are you aware of this in incident reported by colleague Dr Barr? If so, can we have an update, please? If these fragile habitats are polluted, it can cause irreparable damage.

@MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC https://t.co/t44aiheITr

@Andrew9Boswell @Ben_garrod @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia @MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC Hi Andrew. Thanks for this. We had this story https://t.co/qlOv3OOtWX at the weekend, but we'll see what more we can find out about what's happened since.

@Ben_garrod @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia @MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC .@DanGrimmer24 - this is very serious pollution incident to one of our Norfolk Rivers.  Can someone @edp24 investigate please? 

@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia Identifying the source &getting it stopped would be good start - questions later as to why you to are sitting on your #@¬£#s
@EnvAgency @NENorfolkSufflk @N_Rivers_Trust - this needs looking at asap, regardless of the lockdown. https://t.co/5tnwK73lCC
Shocking https://t.co/cO6jMECM98

A landscape-scale project to address the impact of climate change and safeguard a much-loved amenity by returning a Devon estuary and flood plain to a more natural condition, has been given unanimous approval by East Devon District Council planning committee. [1/4] https://t.co/TDIZ5scjuD

tweets.text: @CumbriaRain @metoffice @EnvAgencyNW '..annual total for Honister Pass, 5.25 metres of rain!!.' Does this make it a record for all of England, given this is generally reckoned to be the wettest measured location? And, can we help you get some more readings at altitude! (Itching to throw some innovation at this...!)

@Ben_garrod @EnvAgency @MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC We're aware of this incident and have been monitoring the situation. A team of specialists are due on site today to clear it up.  At this time no fish seem to have been affected. We'll be taking further samples to check invertebrates.

@EnvAgencyAnglia @Ben_garrod @EnvAgency @MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC Great. That is useful- how will you clean up the contaminated land- this flooded and spread over a wide area of grazing land, marsh and wet woodland. including 3 county wildlife sites. Why is the flow still so bad?

@EnvAgencyAnglia @Ben_garrod @EnvAgency @MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC Presumably you will monitor the Norfolk hawker. To measure effect of this incident you need a baseline to compare to. What is the baseline for this or any other invert in this location? I.e. how will you measure the effect of this pollution as claimed?

This is a huge result for #ClimateAdaptation. The River Otter has been trying to reconnect with its flood plain since 1812. This is partnered with a similar project in the Sa√¢ne Valley in France. If successful the model will be rolled out further. #RacetoResilience #adaptourworld https://t.co/LWKN3wdVG6

Updated #Cumbria 2020 monthly & annual #rainfall for selected @EnvAgencyNW raingauges. The ¬£15million Lower Otter Restoration Project at Budleigh Salterton will reconnect the Otter Estuary with its original floodplain for the first time since 1812. [2/4]

European streams and rivers are being strangled lifeless by more than 1 million concrete weirs, dams and other structures, many of which are entirely obsolete. Dam removal and the rewilding of rivers must be a priority in the age of nature restoration.  https://t.co/cf1EN7n8G4
